SingleArgHook< T > Class Template Reference

Detailed Description

template<class T>
class SingleArgHook< T >

Generic concept to allow a simple fn mechanism in APOXI. To define a new point where other modules can hook to, an object SingleArgHook<class T> has to be instantiated. At the place where the hook should be available, the method Call has to be called. This causes the callback function added via Add method to be called. To remove the hook function, method Remove has to be called.

Note: At the moment only one hook function can be added per hooking point!

Adds the callback function 'fn' to the predefined hook.

template<class T>
void SingleArgHook< T >::Call (  T  t  )  [inline]
 

To be called only at this place where the hook callback functions should be called.

template<class T>
BOOLEAN SingleArgHook< T >::Remove (  HookFn  fn  )  [inline]
 

Removes the callback function 'fn' from the predefined hook.
